trans-unit.source: There are several environment variables that must be set depending on the method that you selected to run the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools and startup utilities.

seg-source.mrk: There are several environment variables that must be set depending on the method that you selected to run the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools and startup utilities.

target.mrk: There are several environment variables that must be set depending on the method that you selected to run the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools and startup utilities.

trans-unit.source: As mentioned in <xref href="tgsruntoolsutils.dita#tgsruntoolsutils">choosing a method to run the Derby tools and startup utilities</xref>, you must set the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph> environment variable so that you can use the command examples that are presented in this manual. Adding the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> scripts directory to your command execution PATH makes the scripts easier to use and enables you to use the script examples in this manual. The CLASSPATH environment variable must be set if you are using <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> in a Java program or executing the tools using the <codeph>java</codeph> command.

seg-source.mrk: As mentioned in <xref href="tgsruntoolsutils.dita#tgsruntoolsutils">choosing a method to run the Derby tools and startup utilities</xref>, you must set the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph> environment variable so that you can use the command examples that are presented in this manual.

Adding the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> scripts directory to your command execution PATH makes the scripts easier to use and enables you to use the script examples in this manual.

The CLASSPATH environment variable must be set if you are using <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> in a Java program or executing the tools using the <codeph>java</codeph> command.

target.mrk: As mentioned in <xref href="tgsruntoolsutils.dita#tgsruntoolsutils">choosing a method to run the Derby tools and startup utilities</xref>, you must set the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph> environment variable so that you can use the command examples that are presented in this manual.

Adding the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> scripts directory to your command execution PATH makes the scripts easier to use and enables you to use the script examples in this manual.

The CLASSPATH environment variable must be set if you are using <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> in a Java program or executing the tools using the <codeph>java</codeph> command.

trans-unit.source: The steps below show you how to set the environment variables in a command window. The settings are only valid for that window. If you close the command window or open a new command window, you must set the environment variables again.

seg-source.mrk: The steps below show you how to set the environment variables in a command window.
The settings are only valid for that window.
If you close the command window or open a new command window, you must set the environment variables again.

target.mrk: The steps below show you how to set the environment variables in a command window.
The settings are only valid for that window.
If you close the command window or open a new command window, you must set the environment variables again.

trans-unit.source: You can also set environment variables permanently. For example, on Windows you can use the Control Panel to permanently set the environment variables.

seg-source.mrk: You can also set environment variables permanently.
For example, on Windows you can use the Control Panel to permanently set the environment variables.

target.mrk: You can also set environment variables permanently.
For example, on Windows you can use the Control Panel to permanently set the environment variables.

trans-unit.source: Set the environment variable to the location where you extracted the bin distribution.

seg-source.mrk: Set the environment variable to the location where you extracted the bin distribution.

target.mrk: Set the environment variable to the location where you extracted the bin distribution.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you installed <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> in the <codeph>/opt/<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallname"></ph></codeph> directory on UNIX or in the <codeph>c:\<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallname"></ph></codeph> directory on Windows, use one of the commands in the following table to set the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph> environment variable.

seg-source.mrk: For example, if you installed <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> in the <codeph>/opt/<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallname"></ph></codeph> directory on UNIX or in the <codeph>c:\<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallname"></ph></codeph> directory on Windows, use one of the commands in the following table to set the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph> environment variable.

target.mrk: For example, if you installed <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> in the <codeph>/opt/<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallname"></ph></codeph> directory on UNIX or in the <codeph>c:\<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallname"></ph></codeph> directory on Windows, use one of the commands in the following table to set the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph> environment variable.

trans-unit.source: Commands to set the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph> environment variable

seg-source.mrk: Commands to set the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph> environment variable

target.mrk: Commands to set the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph> environment variable

trans-unit.source: This table lists the commands to set the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph> environment variable on UNIX and Windows systems.

seg-source.mrk: This table lists the commands to set the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph> environment variable on UNIX and Windows systems.

target.mrk: This table lists the commands to set the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph> environment variable on UNIX and Windows systems.

trans-unit.source: Be certain that the <codeph>java</codeph> executable file, version @MINIMUM_JDK@ or higher, is in your command execution PATH. Open a command window and run the <codeph>java -version</codeph> command.

seg-source.mrk: Be certain that the <codeph>java</codeph> executable file, version @MINIMUM_JDK@ or higher, is in your command execution PATH.
Open a command window and run the <codeph>java -version</codeph> command.

target.mrk: Be certain that the <codeph>java</codeph> executable file, version @MINIMUM_JDK@ or higher, is in your command execution PATH.
Open a command window and run the <codeph>java -version</codeph> command.

trans-unit.source: Add the <codeph><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>/bin</codeph> directory to the PATH environment variable so that you can run the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> scripts from any directory, as shown in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: Add the <codeph><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>/bin</codeph> directory to the PATH environment variable so that you can run the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> scripts from any directory, as shown in the following table.

target.mrk: Add the <codeph><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>/bin</codeph> directory to the PATH environment variable so that you can run the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> scripts from any directory, as shown in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Commands to set the PATH environment variable

seg-source.mrk: Commands to set the PATH environment variable

target.mrk: Commands to set the PATH environment variable

trans-unit.source: This table lists the commands to set the PATH environment variable on UNIX and Windows systems.

seg-source.mrk: This table lists the commands to set the PATH environment variable on UNIX and Windows systems.

target.mrk: This table lists the commands to set the PATH environment variable on UNIX and Windows systems.

trans-unit.source: If you use the Control Panel to update your system PATH, add <codeph>%<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>%\bin</codeph> to the end of the PATH environment variable.

seg-source.mrk: If you use the Control Panel to update your system PATH, add <codeph>%<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>%\bin</codeph> to the end of the PATH environment variable.

target.mrk: If you use the Control Panel to update your system PATH, add <codeph>%<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>%\bin</codeph> to the end of the PATH environment variable.

trans-unit.source: When the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph> environment variable is set and the underlying <codeph>/bin</codeph> directory is included in the PATH environment variable, you can use shortened commands to start the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools. Otherwise, either you must be in the directory where the script that starts the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tool is located, or you must specify the full path to the location of the script when you want to start the tool.

seg-source.mrk: When the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph> environment variable is set and the underlying <codeph>/bin</codeph> directory is included in the PATH environment variable, you can use shortened commands to start the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools.

Otherwise, either you must be in the directory where the script that starts the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tool is located, or you must specify the full path to the location of the script when you want to start the tool.

target.mrk: When the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph> environment variable is set and the underlying <codeph>/bin</codeph> directory is included in the PATH environment variable, you can use shortened commands to start the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools.

Otherwise, either you must be in the directory where the script that starts the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tool is located, or you must specify the full path to the location of the script when you want to start the tool.
